Detailed Description

Class to manage with UDP exchange using BIP.

The implementation does not use Client / Server aspect, since this distinction does not exist with UDP. This class manages client or server in a symetric way.

In some description, the term of client is employed, a client is an UDP socket who send a message (an empty message), the source of the message is kept in a list.

Author:
Sebastien Pesnel

Member Function Documentation

UdpConnection * UdpExchange::AcceptConnection (  const UdpConnection &  udp_connect,
bool  msg_empty
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Call when message arrives from a UDP source.

find the UdpConnection object associated to an UDP connection, or create a new UdpConnection object if it is the first connection (first contact is done with empty message). The research is done by using the peer identifier

Parameters:
udp_connect [in] the data of the connection, base for the research or the creation of a new UdpConnection object, contains the peer identifier.
msg_empty [in] define if the message, sent by peer, was empty.
Returns:
NULL if connection refused, or the UdpConnection oebjct associated to the connection.

Reimplemented from Omiscid::MsgSocket.

Reimplemented in Omiscid::Connector.
